intro: Brachysema oxylobioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxylobium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and threatened species.
